org.dataconservancy.packaging.gui.view

Interface PackageDescriptionView

  • All Superinterfaces:
    View<PackageDescriptionPresenter>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PackageDescriptionViewImpl

    public interface PackageDescriptionView
extends View<PackageDescriptionPresenter>
    A view that shows the pacakge description tree, and displays a popup to show package artifact properties. It will also display a popup if the package description isn't valid.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javafx.scene.control.Button getApplyPopupButton()
      Gets the save property popup button, this button should apply any changes to the properties or relationships.
      Map<String,PackageDescriptionViewImpl.ArtifactPropertyContainer> getArtifactPropertyFields()
      Gets the container that holds the text fields representing the properties.
      Set<PackageDescriptionViewImpl.ArtifactRelationshipContainer> getArtifactRelationshipFields()
      Gets the container that holds the text fields representing the relationships.
      javafx.scene.control.TreeView<org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageArtifact> getArtifactTreeView()
      Gets the artifact tree view that displays all the package artifacts.

      Gets the file chooser that's used for saving the pacakge description file.

      • showWarningPopup

        void showWarningPopup(String title,
                      String errorMessage,
                      boolean allowNegative,
                      boolean allowFutureHide)
        Displays the warning popup, this should be used when there is a warning or error that requires action from the user.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the popup
        errorMessage - The error message to display.
        allowNegative - A boolean flag that shows whether the user should be allowed to cancel the popup.
        allowFutureHide - A boolean flag that shows whether the user should be allowed to hide the popup in the future.
